title.narrative: Harvesting and positioning Cordaid expertise on resilience measures

description.narrative: Cordaid project managers/officers and CSO/NGO partners of Cordaid working on the implementation of resilience measures

Long-term objective:
The Resilience Unit has stronger, more coherent knowledge and approaches on key resilience measures, from which they are able to better position themselves as experts on the design and implementation of resilience programming. The quality of implementation of projects will be improved, supported by the toolkit output of the project.
Short-term objective:
Documenting the approaches, basic principles, and track record of a selected number of key measures for resilience building, in a toolkit that describes key resilience measures and their specifics.

The resilience team concludes that our knowledge and approaches on key resilience measures have become scattered, and for some measures we fully rely on partners. We have also not actively communicated our results in the field of implementation on specific measures, with a lack of an updated track record, capacity statement, or position paper on these interventions.
We thus experience challenges to position ourselves as an actor in specific key fields like access to water, climate resilient agriculture, alternative livelihoods (income generation, community saving and loan groups), early warning systems, natural resources management, and other key resilience measures. There is a need to document our track record on specific measures, to document and share approaches and techniques applied in these fields, and to set up a mechanism for collaboration across different countries to share approaches, lessons learned, and innovation.
